q1.title: Thinking About Classes of Service
q1.description: to help teams optimize the execution of their backlog items. Classes of service help differentiate backlog items based on their Cost of Delay (CoD).
q1.subTitle: Classes of Service:

a.text: High (100) - The proposal includes references to open protocols, discoverability and other enablers such as generic components that will allow the solution to be reused, connected and scaled.

b.text: Medium (75) - The proposal includes some reference to open protocols or other enablers for the solution to be reused, connected and scaled.

c.text: Low (25)-  The proposal includes some low impact references to open protocols or other enablers, but nothing substantive.

d.text: Undefined/None (0) -The proposal does not include references to open protocols, discoverability or other enablers to enhance scalability. Proposal may include references to niche software or restrictive vendor agreements.

q2.title: Thinking About Outcomes
q2.description: The positive impact that the initiative will have on users, businesses, program delivery, IT or a specific sector.
q2.subTitle: Outcomes Rationale:

a.text: High (100) - Substantive, transformational or paradigm shifting impact.

c.text: Low (25)- Some targeted and tangible improvements.

d.text: Undefined/None (0)- The benefit to the end-user has not been defined or does not exist.

q3.title: Thinking About Outcomes

a.text: High (100) - Substantive, transformational or paradigm shifting impact.
